file_content.text: So, Nem'ro's little servants are here to raid the archives.
A pity. If you'd raided the armory instead, you might have a chance of surviving.
Hello, Nohn. What brings you down here? Fa'athra finally order you to check out the shooting?
You misunderstand. While lowly thugs sapped your strength, I waited with these men--
I like that about you, Nohn. You only bet on a sure thing.
I like much about you, too. I am sorry the Hutts came between us. The Hutts--and Mistress Blade here, I presume.
I like much about you, too. I am sorry the Hutts came between us. The Hutts--and Master Blade here, I presume.
I take it you two know each other?
You've met before?
No need for formality--really. Just "Blade" is fine.
Let's keep it casual.
I see. It is a pleasure to meet you, then, Blade. I am Nohn Veyaiko, one of Fa'athra's most trusted lieutenants.
Nohn wanted me for himself when I got to Hutta. He couldn't afford me.
Unfortunately, she refused to join with Fa'athra--so now both of you must die. I will make certain your heads are sent to your homeworlds.
I'll tell you what--why don't we make a deal instead?
Let's bargain.
How generous. But Fa'athra pays me very well for my services. What could you possibly provide?
You've got to be kidding. We can kill Nohn--even make it past his guards, if we're lucky.
I'd rather not count on luck. If we can negotiate, let's negotiate.
I'm not kidding.
Work with me, Kaliyo. I want to resolve this peacefully, if possible.
Are you going to help or not?
Eh, fine.
The Blade does have a point, Nohn. Fa'athra doesn't really trust you. Did he warn you he was going to kill Karrels Javis?
Javis is dead? Interesting--but irrelevant. Fa'athra does not share all his plans with me.
Don't be stupid. Fa'athra set you up to take the blame. He kills Karrels; Nem'ro kills... guess who?
Fa'athra would never trade my life away in such a gambit!
Would you bet your life on that?
You sure?
You may... you may have a point.
Drag yourself over to Nem'ro, help him out, and the Hutt might spare you. Probably not, but he might.
With Karrels Javis dead, Nem'ro's going to need a new advisor. Why not abandon Fa'athra and join the other side?
Come work for Nem'ro.
Intriguing. If you speak truly, Fa'athra has concealed much from me. Nem'ro might be a better master after all.
I will give your proposal... due consideration. Perhaps it is best if I withdraw for now.
You won't regret it.
Excellent.
I'm glad we could settle this. Nice meeting you, Nohn Veyaiko.
A pleasure doing business.
You're not leaving me any choice. If you won't bargain, we fight.
Then I have to kill you.
You will die now, Blade. Let the violence commence!
Have it your way, Kaliyo--let's start this fight.
Fine. [Attack]
I agree. Let the violence commence!
While we're making promises, I'll try not to step on your corpse.
I'll still kill you.
Your offer is most generous--but unnecessary. Please kill the Blade, men.
I am Nohn Veyaiko, one of Fa'athra's most trusted lieutenants. These men are Fa'athra's elite. And you, Blade, have no chance of winning this fight.
Why don't we make a deal?
Maybe we can bargain.
Because I am a loyal servant of Fa'athra. And because while you are weak from fighting through this palace, I am at the peak of my strength.
Please kill the Blade, men.
I've already marched across the swamps, fought Fa'athra's army of thugs and invaded your palace. You really think you can stop me now?
You can't beat me.
You are... confident, aren't you? Perhaps I should have waited longer before striking.
I... propose a deal. I will turn my back on this scene and depart the archives, and you will not shoot me on your way out. I will mention none of this to Fa'athra.
Hmm... aren't you forgetting something, Nohn? Seems like you're getting off light, and there was that game of pazaak we never finished....
Ah, yes. I would... also be willing to transfer a sum of credits to your accounts. Old debts paid, and a symbol of my gratitude.
I... propose a deal. I will turn my back on this scene and depart the archives, and you will not shoot me on your way out. I will mention none of this to Fa'athra.
I'll accept those terms.
All right.
Just get out of here and don't cause me any trouble.
Whatever.
Come then, men. Let us leave the Blade to her work.
Come then, men. Let us leave the Blade to his work.
No deal. I can't let you walk away.
I don't think so.
We shall see if your luck holds, then. Let the violence commence!
If you're with Fa'athra, you're dead. Simple as that.
I'm not backing down.
We shall see. Let the violence commence!
I knew coming here would be a good time.
A moment, please. I am otherwise engaged.
Fa'athra's elite. Now, you are too weak to fight us.
